moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5 4. Nf3: I am in general not a fan of this opening for black as he lacks some stability and is living off pins and threats.
moves.5. Be2 Bxf3 6. Bxf3 c6: An okay defensive move. Black really needs to get his pieces out though.
moves.7. O-O e6: Where are all black's minor pieces?
moves.8. d4 Be7 9. Bd2 Qb6: I think this is a ?! Black is behind on development and is going pawn grabbing. This is usually not a good idea in a game but sometimes in blitz aggressive moves pay off since there is not as much time to analyze. This move does win a pawn.
moves.12. Nb5: ! This move keeps the game interesting beyond a boring queen trade. I am threatening Nc7+ winning the rook and being up the exchange unless black can take my knight.
moves.12... cxb5: ? This is the wrong response and loses.
moves.13. Qxb5+ Nc6: ? I think Nd7 is better as the knight is protected by the king. Even if black has to form a fortress, it does not crumble like it does here.
moves.14. Qxb7: I think black is lost at this point.
moves.14... Rb8 15. Bxc6+ Kf8 16. Qxb8+: 16. Bxb4+ is a very bad idea due to 16. ... Qxb4 17. Qxb4 Rxb4
moves.16... Ke7 17. Bxb4+ Kf6 18. Rad1: At last a non-check move. At this point I was not sure how to finish the game and just wanted to develop a mating net.
moves.18... Qb6: Trying to force a queen trade
moves.22. Rd6+ Ke7 23. Qd7+ Kf8 24. Qe8#: The end combination is not as exciting as the rampage the queen and bishops earlier on. Often, one should really watch out for pawn grabbing when he's behind development. I make that mistake often though since I get greedy.
